Target-independent code in foldMemoryOperand will take care of adding a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinememoperand">MachineMemOperand</a> to the newly created instruction. The instruction and any auxiliary instructions necessary will be inserted at InsertPt.

If <code>OffsetIsScalable</code> is set to &#39;true&#39;, the offset is scaled by <code>vscale</code>.

This is true for some SVE instructions like ldr/str that have a &#39;reg + imm&#39; addressing mode where the immediate is an index to the scalable vector located at &#39;reg + imm &#42; vscale x #bytes&#39;.

### optimizeCompareInstr() {#abc0f8152bb9c4cdd79a31196933bb5df}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool AArch64InstrInfo::optimizeCompareInstr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; CmpInstr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> SrcReg, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> SrcReg2, int64&#95;t CmpMask, int64&#95;t CmpValue, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineregisterinfo">MachineRegisterInfo</a> &#42; MRI) const</>}>
optimizeCompareInstr - Convert the instruction supplying the argument to the comparison into one that sets the zero bit in the flags register.

Try to optimize a compare instruction.

A compare instruction is an instruction which produces AArch64::NZCV. It can be truly compare instruction when there are no uses of its destination register.

The following steps are tried in order:
<ul>
<li>Convert CmpInstr into an unconditional version.</li>
<li>Remove CmpInstr if above there is an instruction producing a needed condition code or an instruction which can be converted into such an instruction. Only comparison with zero is supported.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64instrinfo-h/#l00430">430</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64instrinfo-h">AArch64InstrInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64instrinfo-cpp/#l01547">1547</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64instrinfo-cpp">AArch64InstrInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### optimizeCondBranch() {#af0bbac5dd9f698f2c73477c4e5f36b60}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool AArch64InstrInfo::optimizeCondBranch (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; MI) const</>}>
Replace csincr-branch sequence by simple conditional branch.

Examples:
<ul>
<li><ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">csinc  w9, wzr, wzr, &lt;condition code&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">tbnz   w9, #0, 68</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing> to 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea92eb5ffee6ae2fec3ad71c777531578f">b</a>.&lt;inverted condition code&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing></li>
<li><ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">csinc w9, wzr, wzr, &lt;condition code&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">tbz   w9, #0, 68</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing> to 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea92eb5ffee6ae2fec3ad71c777531578f">b</a>.&lt;condition code&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing></li>
</ul>


Replace compare and branch sequence by TBZ/TBNZ instruction when the compare&#39;s constant operand is power of 2.

Examples: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">and  w8, w8, #0x400</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">cbnz w8, L1</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing> to 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">tbnz w8, #10, L1</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="MI">Conditional Branch</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
True when the simple conditional branch is generated
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64instrinfo-h/#l00433">433</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64instrinfo-h">AArch64InstrInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64instrinfo-cpp/#l08421">8421</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64instrinfo-cpp">AArch64InstrInfo.cpp</a>.

Examples:
<ul>
<li><ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">csinc w9, wzr, wzr, ne</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">cmp   w9, #0</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing> to 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">csinc w9, wzr, wzr, ne</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing></li>
<li><ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">csinc x2, xzr, xzr, mi</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">cmp   x2, #1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea92eb5ffee6ae2fec3ad71c777531578f">b</a>.pl</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing> to 
<ProgramListing>

</ProgramListing></li>
</ul>

True when comparison removed
</SectionUser>

### getMemOpInfo() {#a08a16d97f309936fcfd4c2dbb74b5050}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool AArch64InstrInfo::getMemOpInfo (unsigned Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a> &amp; Scale, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a> &amp; Width, int64&#95;t &amp; MinOffset, int64&#95;t &amp; MaxOffset)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Returns true if opcode <code>Opc</code> is a memory operation.

If it is, set <code>Scale</code>, <code>Width</code>, <code>MinOffset</code>, and <code>MaxOffset</code> accordingly.

For unscaled instructions, <code>Scale</code> is set to 1. All values are in bytes. MinOffset/MaxOffset are the un-scaled limits of the immediate in the instruction, the actual offset limit is &#91;MinOffset&#42;Scale, MaxOffset&#42;Scale&#93;.
